It was good, but not as good as the first one. Midway through the game I started to get bored because I felt like the game was taking a long time just messing around. I did start to like it again shortly after we reunited with Wheatley and it had a neat ending but I liked the first one more, this game did keep my attention but I wanted to stop playing midway through and play portal one again. I did enjoy it once I pushed myself to keep going and finish the game. The multiplayer was fun, my friend and I enjoyed it.

Valve is just the gift that keeps on giving, and Portal 2 shows that. Yes, it is a puzzler, and yes, it's a very complicated one at that. But the puzzles are so fun, and the dialogue of GlaDOS and Wheatley make this game so funny and enjoyable to play. It's not an open world adventure like GTA V or an addicting multiplayer game, but it's so satisfying when you get that puzzle, and every step towards completing a level feels awesome. This game is a sensational game, and I wish Valve would make a third one. I still get goosebumps at the end of this long adventure, and I always will. It requires patience, yes, but it's all worth it when you use that patience to get through the levels. What a game, Valve. What a game.
Portal 2 is really worth a try. The story, the characters, the gameplay, the jokes, all great. If you are really into puzzle games, or just games in general, then play this amazing game.

(Note: I, like Portal, have completed this game fully as well).  Imagine taking the original game, 'Portal', injecting steroids into it, and having another character added to the mix.  Well, what do you get?  You get this game, Portal 2.  All the things I said about Portal are true here as well for Portal 2, plus more.  Portal 2 takes the formula of Portal and expands upon it leagues upon it.  You still have the portal gun, but now the puzzles take an interesting turn.  There's goop now that gives Chell certain effects, such as increased speed or higher jumps when jumped on.  It adds to the layer of diversity the puzzles have.  There's also these anti-gravity cylinders that can be redirected via the portal gun.  The story has been vastly improved over Portal's.  Chell (you) wakes up after a coma from the first game and finds out from a certain robot named Wheatly (hint, hint: not a good guy) that everyone is dead.  Then, they go through the leftovers of the Aperture Science facilities to find that GLaDOS from the first game is not dead.  The game then revolves around Chell figuring out who is the right person to follow: Wheatly or GLaDOS.  It's a pretty interesting dynamic that really adds depth to the story.  This game is double the length of the first game, but it's still more of the great fun.  The turrets are still as charming as ever and the actors for both Wheatly and GLaDOS perform great.  The sound design is also quite good as well.  The graphics have been improved thanks to advancements to the Source engine and lighting looks quite good for a game from 2011/2012.  Overall, I say that Portal built the framework and base that Portal 2 works off and builds skyscraper from.
